documents.document: @StephenAMcMahon That's one of the key reasons why we need proper supports no one can care for someone with a complex disease without training, without support and often 24/7 - we end up with 2 ill people We need everyday supports & properly trained family & professional carers

@LydieSM @CarersTrust @BBCNews Totally agree - so much focus on childcare and so little focus on those of us who have had to care for parents or other relatives. Family carers save the State millions with proper home supports we could do both

@sinead_ryan @SimonHarrisTD @jimdalytd @HSELive 2. We need integrated communities that support people of all ages and abilities to live in their community with proper supports. Would you agree with setting up disability villages?

@sinead_ryan @SimonHarrisTD @jimdalytd @HSELive 1. With respect I disagree. Research shows that people do best in their own home. Particularly important for people with dementia who need the familiarity that a lifelong home brings. If people want to live in a Ret home that's fine but it is segregation by age.
@roisiningle Dizzy Daisy and Scruffy make me smile today and everyday. Great company while I work from home Always happy to see me and perfect cuddlers https://t.co/tLO4nECmIf
Dasher, Dancer, Dizzy, Daisy and Scruffy #SantasLittleHelpers https://t.co/8A568e04Uv

@jimdalytd We need to create communities that care where young, old, healthy, unwell, & those with disabilities can live together with the supports they need. Be great not to use the term â€˜elderlyâ€™ - all of us whatever our age should be supported to live at home
RT @SimonHarrisTD: 550 additional home care packages being put in place to help reduce delayed discharges in our hospitals - particularly hâ€¦

@SimonHarrisTD @jimdalytd @HSELive Great to hear. Could you also advise @jimdalytd to revisit his idea of retirement villages. People want to remain in their own homes & do best there. Integration not segregation. The patient must choose not families or medics. #assisteddecisionmaking

@PantiBliss Oh no a Bill Whelan Plague....
@KatieO_Connor_ She's been found https://t.co/uc3wZp0ZXG
This looks really interesting - I'd love to go but I'll be working in London - I'm sure it will be fascinating go if you can https://t.co/5VKJKHhffb

#UniversalChildrensDay To protect all dogs in the kennels You can't kennel your dog unless they've had their shots Kindergartens in the US operate the same system Kids have to be vaccinated to attend Unless you have a religious exemption #VaccinesWork https://t.co/bKjIREBY2m

On #UniversalChildrensDay remember one of the best ways that you can protect your child is to vaccinate them and indeed to vaccinate yourself. Vaccines aren't just for kids they're for life - #VaccinesWork https://t.co/xIdmgjV7TF
RT @alzheimersocirl: â€œTilt the balance of spending back to #HomeCare given 96% of older people live in their own homeâ€. Sean Moynihan of @Aâ€¦

@MaireCorbett @jimdalytd @alzheimersocirl @ALONE_IRELAND @AgeAction @activeirl @Age_Opp @AgeFriendlyIrl With what the Minister proposes it sounds like that if you need supports you will be forced to move to a retirement village because he won't fund community supports - this goes completely agains the National Positive Ageing strategy which supports integrated community living

@MaireCorbett @jimdalytd @alzheimersocirl @ALONE_IRELAND @AgeAction @activeirl @Age_Opp @AgeFriendlyIrl If you choose to move from your long term home to another home in a retirement village in later life thats fine. But if you want to remain in your own home within the integrated community with people of all ages then you should be able to do that with proper community supports

@MaireCorbett @jimdalytd @alzheimersocirl @ALONE_IRELAND @AgeAction @activeirl @Age_Opp @AgeFriendlyIrl Fine if that's what you choose. The minister proposes this instead of home supports. its old folks homes by another name. People should be supported to live in their own homes research shows thats where we do best. it is segregation by age. Would you make disability villages?

The home care option is the most cost effective, indeed it is the cheapest by far and it produces the best health outcomes. Why won't @jimdalytd and @SimonHarrisTD listen? The @alzheimersocirl's modest budget submission for home care support was completely ignored. WHY? https://t.co/hYW2ktClLG

@sarahmdonnelly1 I find it very worrying that the patient doesn't appear to have a voice in these decisions. #HumanRights #Ageism No one would dream of suggesting that younger people with disabilities who need supports be sent to live in nursing homes or villages rather than their own homes
RT @sarahmdonnelly1: Well said @Sabina_Brennan.The majority of older people want to age-in-place, in their own homes, with the necessary #â€¦

Why will @jimdalytd not listen to what older people want and need. His role is to protect the rights of older people & support independent living not to force them into care & segregation. What about the positive ageing strategy? @drivetimerte https://t.co/sgKKUAqeSZ
This is brilliant from @JaneyGodley Well worth a watch - warning Scottish accent and swearing ðŸ˜‡ #Brexit https://t.co/H40kiB0xSK

Blaming families for not engaging with the Hobson's choice of Hospital or Nursing Home. Older people want to go home not to an institution. No mention in this article of what the patient wants. Provide proper home supports @jimdalytd @alzheimersocirl https://t.co/AfIfeCJGhz

Men get a lot of generalisations thrown at them I don't believe gender dictates whether you are nasty or nice (sorry Santa) Anyway on #InternationalMensDay I want to give a shout out to the fabulously supportive men in my life @BrennanDave @BrennanDarren @gav4sax @theoriginal_JD https://t.co/V68NozWmJr
@JFTAXI @ciarakellydoc @philipnolan1 @jonnyfallon â›¹ï¸â€â™€ï¸â›¹ï¸â€â™‚ï¸â›¹ï¸â€â™‚ï¸â›¹ï¸â€â™‚ï¸â›¹ï¸â€â™€ï¸

@ciarakellydoc @philipnolan1 @JFTAXI @jonnyfallon I really don't care that you didn't even pick me for the team ðŸ˜‚ I don't care, really I don't even though my 'S' would have saved Philip from being last
Itâ€™s very hard to say no to Dizzy when she wants a cuddle. One of the challenges of working from home. ðŸ¶ https://t.co/Y8EvDcWbEZ

#mondayMotivation Eddie, who only took up running at 50, competes in her 7th Ironman in Mexico on Sunday - For more on this inspirational woman read the Interview with @MagsJennings in @irishexaminer https://t.co/8ABxLDLI7F

@JFTAXI @ciarakellydoc @philipnolan1 We are in agreement. Success takes many shapes and forms. Society's measure of success is not always the most important. Particularly if it is measured in monetary terms as once basic needs are met there is no correlation between money & happiness.

#MondayMotivation We don't lose muscle mass just because we age We lose muscle mass because we stop exercising It's never too late to start Ernestine started lifting at 56 She is 81in this photo Inactivity increases your risk of dementia Get exercising now to boost #brainhealth https://t.co/XwpKk0ESkm
@philipnolan1 @JFTAXI @ciarakellydoc Did you get your trophy back? I keep thinking about it because it is so like something I would do.

@philipnolan1 @JFTAXI @ciarakellydoc Yes I get what you are saying about the devastation - it's more the embarrassment really of being last one picked. I never scored high on the popularity stakes & I think the team picking was more about control & cliques than anything else.

@JFTAXI @ciarakellydoc @philipnolan1 indeed having supportive parents or at least one supportive adult contributes to resilience but not all successful people are self-confident in fact lingering issues of self-esteem can be drivers of success - I'm speaking generally now - not analysing Ciara or Philip
Can you see what I see? An exhibition informed by the dementia experience by Caroline Hyland on display in Taillight Hospital from Nov 7th to 29th - check it out https://t.co/yT5EVlb7Pu

@ciarakellydoc @philipnolan1 Itâ€™s a horrible practice that destroys self esteem. Both of you with your amazing success prove my little theory though that not getting picked can be a great motivator to spur you to be the best you can be as an adult. The downside is that it can crush less resilient kids.
RT @ciarakellydoc: Iâ€™m sorry but this is bit rich coming from head of one of the wealthiest organizations in the world who still havenâ€™t evâ€¦
Have you seen this girl? GardaÃ­ seek help tracing girl (16) missing from Tallaght in Dublin https://t.co/uggb0ST60F via @IrishTimes

@VCurrentAffairs I feel like I'm in a bad dream, you know the sort where it's bits of reality mixed in with utter nonsense - how can he still be president? He doesn't seem to do any real work - just tweets garbage and spouts more incendiary garbage at rally's.

@gemeroo Why elevate women for doing something inequitable? Why not elevate the families who share the load. It makes no sense to me. Lauding people for doing something you want to change? Praise the behaviour you want to encourage not the one you want to eradicate.

@GrahamMasterton @adidas @Nike Ha ha. We are a sporty family. It did cross my mind that someone might call the Gardai to report a suspicious looking group since we were having a good nose around some new builds in the area. I'm sure we looked like we were casing the joint.
Went for a walk with my family last night to burn off some of the excess. While out we noticed we were all wearing â¦@adidasâ© track bottoms and â¦@Nikeâ© trainers. Oops https://t.co/zaa09hUNkR

@eosull @colettebrowne @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc 2/2 If I was to give a shout out to all the 'Firemen' who worked over xmas - I would 'sexist' to ignore the 'fire women' The argument was given that women are in the majority for xmas work so ok not to mention the men. Seems like a double standard to me, that's all.

@eosull @colettebrowne @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc 1/2 it was factual rather than disingenuous I was not referring to all men as a minority but rather quoting the flip side of the original tweet - if women are in the majority for xmas work then that means men who do this work are in the minority.

@gemeroo I agree, My point though is that by giving a 'shout out' to women only you play into gendered roles & continue supporting the inequality However if you commend everyone who does it males & females you encourage more equality does that make sense? Always hard on twitter to nuance
@daithigor loved her in Killing Eve

@cr15b @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc Ah I see - my conversation was about the original tweet see screenshot. Call me Sabina - the Dr is only there as part of twitter movement whereby women were reticent about highlighting their qualifications as experts https://t.co/l0JV1R7nOc

@ciarakellydoc @colettebrowne @barbarascully I was referring to the men who do pull xmas together Tthey are by reference to the original tweet in the minority. It is unfair to say that men choose not to pull their weight Many women choose to do all the prep by agreement or by choice because they want to be in control

@john_mcguirk @cr15b @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc 2/2 I'm female & passionate about equality & human rights I believe if we see people before gender, orientation etc then we will make real progress. I fear making this a about gender engrains the stereotype.

@john_mcguirk @cr15b @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc 1/2 I don't need it explained. Barbara is entitled to say what she wishes & I respect that. I will comment if I agree with Barbara & so it is important to comment if something jars with me. My point was why make it a gender issue just say yay to all people.

@colettebrowne @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc I don't agree - if you want to get more equality in the home/Christmas prep then acknowledge all who do the work not just the women. To only acknowledge the women entrenches the 'gendered role'

@cr15b @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc Barbara (sorry for taking about you in the third person I respect you hugely) For me its about a wider issue I think we will make more progress in terms of equality if we see humans before gender Barbara is a human so why not just shout out to all everyone who made xmas happen.
@colettebrowne @barbarascully @ciarakellydoc In this context men are in the minority in terms of those who do most of the work in preparing for xmas.

@barbarascully @ciarakellydoc I also think it's good to have these conversations - but important not to make presumptions about where people are coming from. I think some comments to you were rude and unfair but equally some comments to those who disagreed were also unfair - conversation would be good.

@barbarascully @ciarakellydoc I was referring to the presumption that ingrained patriarchy was the reason people were annoyed by your tweet. It wasn't the reason in my family. I think many men have reached their threshold after a year of being painted in bad light Your tweet may well have been a last straw

@barbarascully @ciarakellydoc Have you asked any of them why they are insulted? The men in my house were insulted by the tweet. They felt it was divisive & tars all men with a 'lazy' brush. My son in a same sex marriage, felt negated - where does that leave their xmas efforts?

@barbarascully @ciarakellydoc Why not just say yay to the people who pulled Christmas together? That's the point. The essence of equality is to ensure that minorities are treated equally so by ignoring the minority (men) in this instance who pull xmas together you go against those fundamental principles.
Happy publication day to @GilesYeo 'Gene Eating' https://t.co/ZX3t3uwZuZ
@ciarakellydoc Itâ€™s a lovely photo

@ciarakellydoc @barbarascully I don't believe it is patriarchy. Certainly not from me. Why not just thank all people who pulled xmas together. I found the tweet insulting. Personally I'm fed up with this brand of feminism It goes against principles of equality. Acknowledge good people irrespective of gender
@BookishChat some great non-fiction due in 2019 too - just saying' ðŸ˜‹

@MariaTT Years ago myself and my then boyfriend went on a sun holiday with another couple that we both worked with. They got engaged on the plane over, then spent the whole holiday telling everyone & wouldn't come out for drinks or dinner because they were saving to get married!
@joeheenan you can't buy that gorgeous, happy, smile
@Stephanenny stunning dog - the real one

@barbarascully But that's the point exactly you didn't thank ALL who made it happen you only thanked the women. I'm not angry, I agree with you on lots of issues but I did feel in this tweet if thanks are to be given it shouldn't be restricted to just one gender.

Believing that the world would be a better place if we see others simply as humans rather distinguishing them by gender, ethnicity, orientation, age, nationality etc. #ThingsImNotApologizingFor https://t.co/kiP1l8g4AJ

@barbarascully Iâ€™m the only female in my house. The guys did most of the food which was awesome. Hubby did most of food shopping. Present shopping was shared. Thatâ€™s not just on Xmas either we share the load all year. No martyrs.

@GrahamMasterton @sweetoblivion26 only joking - have a lovely day tomorrow Graham - with regard to the radio - nowadays you can appear on radio since a lot of the stations stream live video from the studio ðŸ˜€

@TomRourke @electionlit He favoured light suits so you remember wen most were either beige or light grey. Yes he proudly wore his pioneer pin and also his pin for donating blood. That's funny about the colour TV treat. It's just mad how advanced things have become - Have a lovely xmas Tom
@GrahamMasterton @sweetoblivion26 Do it was you Mr Masterton who sent those emails

@electionlit Yup My childhood There were no console games, no laptops. Only black & white TV. We had an aerial on our roof though so we could get HTV. With regard to the alcohol my parents like most of my friendâ€™s parents were pioneers. Fun times! We did have shoes. Usually just one pair tho

@sweetoblivion26 I got a similar email a few months back after appearing on radio. I thought Iâ€™d been singled out & felt suitably chastised. After reading your tweet I suspect itâ€™s a form of â€˜train spottingâ€™

@Colmogorman @MarianKeyes The shock of dad's sudden death was horrific The pain visceral. He was 87 but people saying he was a great age was really unhelpful He wore a flat cap & a beige coat I hadn't noticed how many men of his vintage dressed the same I saw him everywhere. With time pain lessens Grieve
